Title.En: Creativity and Collective Creativity in Organizations

Description.En:
One of the primary objectives of this module is to shift the narrative from the conventional understanding of creativity as an individual endeavor to a more nuanced perspective that recognizes the power and potential of collaborative efforts. By doing so, participants will develop a profound understanding of how group dynamics, team interactions, and shared perspectives contribute to the emergence of innovative ideas and solutions.

Content summary:

- Introduction to the creative process
- Team and collective creativity
- Organisational mechanisms to support collective creativity
- Leading for creativity

NoteLiteral.En: Learning the process of reciprocal influence exercised by individuals over one another during social encounters.
Using imagination or original ideas to create change.

Title.En: Creativity and Collective Creativity in Organizations
Creativity and Collective Creativity in Organizations

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
This course is designed to explore the characteristics and challenges of creativity and collective creativity at work. In particular, the module encourages to move the main focus from individual creativity to forms of collective creativity (group or team creativity).

Using different case studies, the course also aims to explore the mechanisms that can support collective creativity by design.

To apply, please upload:

- your CV in English;
- if available, the English language certification
- a brief motivational letter (1.000 characters) OR a motivational video (max 40’’, preferably youtube link) where you explain WHY you are interested in THIS learning opportunity.
- Transcript of records

Please identify your Applicant status:

1. UniTrento PhD or Student
2. ECIU student
3. Erasmus+ or Bilateral agreement student (in Trento for the whole semester)
4. Student enrolled in Erasmus+ (non ECIU) partner University, applying for a challenge or BIP-Blended Intensive Program in Trento
5. Other (extra fees may apply)

Status 1, 2 and 3 applicants need to submit two applications (similar documents, same deadline on 25 September):  

[SOI admission apply 2024/25 - S2](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/Web/GoHome/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_2)  

[ECIU Admission application](https://engage.eciu.eu/browse?universityIds=c7bc8551-6a54-ed11-bba2-6045bd886566&learningOppStatuses=1)

Status 4 and 5 applicants only submit their application in the [SOI admission apply 2024/25 - S2](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/Web/GoHome/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_2)

[Here](https://www.soi.unitn.it/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Applying_to_SOI_ECIU_activities.docx.pdf)you can find guidelines on the application process.
